Sentencas: Supported electrolyte-membrane-type solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) were prepared by a co-fire process using Zr(Sc)O-2 (SSZ) and Ce(Gd)O-2 (GDC) as electrolyte.
Titulo: Supported Zr(Sc)O2 SOFCs for reduced temperature prepared by electrophoretic deposition

Sentencas: Electrolyte films were prepared on supports, such as a mixture of Ni and electrolyte, by electrophoretic deposition (EPD) method and then co-fired.
Titulo: Supported Zr(Sc)O2 SOFCs for reduced temperature prepared by electrophoretic deposition

Sentencas: It was concluded that co-firing of GDC electrolyte cell would not be feasible because of its fragility during sintering and cell operation.
Titulo: Supported Zr(Sc)O2 SOFCs for reduced temperature prepared by electrophoretic deposition

Sentencas: The co-firing of SSZ cells (Ni--SSZ/SSZ/Pt-SSZ) gave successful results.
Titulo: Supported Zr(Sc)O2 SOFCs for reduced temperature prepared by electrophoretic deposition

Sentencas: The Optimum power density was 1.8, 1.2, 0.4, and 0.1 W/cm(2) at 900, 800, 700, and 600 degreesC, respectively.
Titulo: Supported Zr(Sc)O2 SOFCs for reduced temperature prepared by electrophoretic deposition

Sentencas: Further improvement of the electrode will make the cell operation even at 600 degreesC feasible.
Titulo: Supported Zr(Sc)O2 SOFCs for reduced temperature prepared by electrophoretic deposition

Sentencas: However, improvement of the cathode using (La,Sr)CoO3 (LSC) was unsuccessful due to the formation of an insulating layer with SSZ.
Titulo: Supported Zr(Sc)O2 SOFCs for reduced temperature prepared by electrophoretic deposition

Sentencas: The insertion of GDC protective layer (2 mum) between SSZ and LSC cathode was examined, but the results were worse than the case of Pt-SSZ cathode.
Titulo: Supported Zr(Sc)O2 SOFCs for reduced temperature prepared by electrophoretic deposition

Sentencas: It may be due to the formation of a poor conducting layer between GDC, LSC and SSZ.
Titulo: Supported Zr(Sc)O2 SOFCs for reduced temperature prepared by electrophoretic deposition
Supported Zr(Sc)O2 SOFCs for reduced temperature prepared by electrophoretic deposition
